fn.p: Data presented as mean ± standard deviation. BDI = Beck Depression Inventory (0–10 points: no depression, 11–17 points: mild to moderate level of depressive symptoms, ≥18 clinically relevant); BMI = body mass index; HRmax = maximum heart rate in performance diagnostic; EHI = Edinburgh-Handedness-Inventory; WST IQ = verbal intelligence quotient of the German vocabulary test; L.Q. = Laterality Quotient (a value > +40 indicates right-handedness); relVO2max = maximum oxygen consumption relative to body weight; STAI trait = trait anxiety of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (clinically relevant anxiety scores are ≥39); * two-sided.
